Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the amount of money spent on the military by stating that it is more than the next 12 nations combined, when in reality it is more than the next 10 or 8 nations combined, depending on the source.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to back up the statement that the US has spent more money on the military than the next 12 nations combined.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the difference in military spending between the US and other nations, such as differing priorities, geopolitical considerations, or defense strategies.
